results.title: Sample people
results.creator_credit: Clinton Smith, Barton Smith, Emile Sherman, Living Motion Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Phil’s falafel shop is where it all goes down - some peoples’ lives culminate in a single defining moment and how they all get to that point over a forty-eight hour period is the storyline. Set in 1990s Sydney, the drug and techno music lifestyle of a group of young men and women is explored. DJ Lush Puppy (Nathalie Roy), the good-looking girl DJ and skateboard rider, is friend of Jess (Kylie Minogue) who is working in the sleazy underworld crime scene. Jess and her beau (Simon Lyndon) aim to make off with some cash, leaving the gangster lifestyle behind. Homeboy Joey and his mate Gus have a gun and not much to occupy their time except to be wild and crazy out on the streets. Sam (Joel Edgerton) has a premonition that his girlfriend is going to overdose and wants to get out of town on a holiday. Nightclubbing, sex and hallucinogenic trips send the friends into a spin and pursuit by the upset gangsters sets up some tension - all leading them to Phil’s Falafels where an armed robbery and death occur. Some lighter moments and one-liners aim to relieve the tense atmosphere, as does the rock/techno soundtrack. Cast includes: Ben Mendelsohn, David Field, Paula Arundell, Justin Rosniak, Matthew Wilkinson, Gandhi MacIntyre, Dorian Nkono.

results.title: Grievous bodily harm
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Richard Brennan, Australian Film Commission, FGH Film Consortium, International Film Management and Smiley Films
results.brief_description: Made in 1988, this police drama delves into the world of prostitution, corruption and redemption. Journalist Tom Stewart (Colin Friels) investigates a robbery and the death of a woman (Joy Bell) who was married to Morris Martin (John Waters) an obsessive man with a means to murder. Detective Ray Birch (Bruno Lawrence) is also investigating the robbery but is keeping information from Tom. The drama unfolds as the threads of connection appear between the main protagonists and it is revealed the woman actually faked her death to escape Martin. Cast includes: Kim Gyngell, Sandy Gore, John Flaus, Kerry Armstrong and Austen Tayshus.

results.title: The True story of Eskimo Nell
results.creator_credit: Richard Franklin, Ron Baneth and Quest Films
results.brief_description: Two horny rogues on a road trip are out to find the illustrious lover (aka ‘womper’) from Alaska named Eskimo Nell. Dead Eye Dick (Max Gillies) and Mexico Pete (Serge Lazareff) travel around the Australian goldfields trying to bed women wherever they go. Dead Eye Dick is more talk than action as he has his heart set on finding Nell. Very much the storyteller, Dead Eye’s fanciful tales land the two in trouble and they often have to leave town in a hurry. Boobs and bawdiness abound in this ‘historical’ comedy drama from writers Alan Hopgood and Richard Franklin - also produced and directed by Franklin. Music by Brian May. Cast includes Abigail, Grahame Bond, Kris McQuade, Elli Maclure, Paul Vachon, Anthony Bazell, Ernie Bourne.

results.title: Things to do in Denver when you're dead
results.creator_credit: Gary Fleder, Cary Woods and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: The plot centres around a motley gang of mobsters with names like Jimmy the Saint, Pieces, Franchise, Easy Wind and Critical Bill, all who are trying to go straight but are doomed to be called back for one final job. Jimmy the Saint’s (Andy Garcia) “Afterlife Advice” business for terminally ill clients (where they can videotape future advice for their loved ones) is falling into a hole rapidly. Needing some finance Jimmy turns to his old boss The Man With The Plan (Christopher Walken) for help but in return he has to do a favour for The Man - “rough up” The Man’s son’s ex-girlfriend’s new boyfriend! Jimmy calls in the old Gang and together they hatch an elaborate plan, a plan that ends up going horribly wrong. Stars Christopher Lloyd, William Forsythe, Bill Nunn, Treat Williams, Jack Warden, Steve Buscemi, Fairuza Balk.

results.title: Born yesterday
results.creator_credit: Luis Mandoki, D Constantine Conte, Lester Berman, Hollywood Pictures and Touchwood Pacific Partners
results.brief_description: A remake of the Judy Holliday film from 1950, this version stars Melanie Griffiths in the title role as the gauche mistress of a shady businessman. Keen to enter politics, but reluctant to ditch his liability, he makes her over with the aid of the tutor Paul Verrall (Don Johnson, in the role originally played by William Holden). Billie gains more than just an education however - she falls in love, starts to value herself and begins to recognise the transgressions of her brutish lover. Based on the play by Garson Kanin.

results.title: The Swindle = Il Bidone
results.brief_description: Three small time confidence tricksters unite to try and get money by robing the poor. “Il Bidone” is crime-doesn’t-pay film with a realistic starkness only Fellini could instigate. Strong performances play out in a harsh setting and with dire consequences for the main protagonist Augusto (Broderick Crawford) as he tries to help his estranged daughter with money to attend college but ends up betrayed by those who, like him, are swindlers up to no good. The second film in Fellini’s so called trilogy about loneliness (which include “La Strada” and “Le Notti di Cabiria”). Cast includes: Giulietta Masina, Richard Basehart, Franco Fabrizi.

results.title: The Idol = L'Idole
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: Directed by Australian Samantha Lang (The Monkey’s mask), this is a tale of two different souls who find solace in each other - and a kind of obsession. Set in Paris, France in an apartment block with a winding staircase that binds the people who live there. In an empty apartment opposite the elderly resident of Chinese origin called Zao (James Hong) arrives the beautiful and melodramatic Sarah (Leelee Sobieski), a young theatre actress from Australia. Sarah wants to feign a suicide to scandalise her relationship with her married lover but until she does the deed Zao asks that he may cook for her. Together they face the prospect of the end of life, love and sexual yearning - and an enjoyment of good food. Based on the novel “A L’Heure Dite” by Michelle Tourneur.

results.title: Till human voices wake us
results.creator_credit: Michael Petroni, David Redman, Dean Murphy, Matthias Emcke, Nigel Odell, Shana Levine, Thomas Augsberger, AFFC, Cinemedia, Entertainment Finance Group, Globe Film Company and Instinct Entertainment
results.brief_description: Lyrical and moody, a reflective piece about first love, love lost and memories. Initially set in the 1960s in a small Victorian country town, a teenage boy returns home from boarding school to his father, the town doctor, and his best friend Silvy. On the night of the town dance Sam and Silvy slip away to go for a swim, unfortunately with dire consequences. Twenty years later Sam (Guy Pearce), now a psychologist, returns to fulfil his father’s final wish to be buried in Genoa. He meets a strange woman called Ruby (Helena Bonham-Carter) on the train and she proves to be a link for Sam back to his Silvy and his lost emotions. Written and directed by Michael Petroni in his feature film debut with original music composed by Dale Cornelius. Cast includes Frank Gallacher, Lindley Joyner, Brooke Harman.

results.title: Bed and board = Domicile conjugal
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, Marcel Berbert, Fida Cinematografica, Films du Carrosse and Valoria
results.brief_description: Fourth instalment in Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” series depicts the still somewhat immature Antoine facing the birth of his first child, infatuation with a Japanese woman and the petty squabbles of married life. Whilst perhaps not as well realised as “Stolen kisses”, “Bed and board” nevertheless maintains a laconic charm, aided by the redoubtable Truffaut mainstay, Jean-Pierre Leaud.

results.title: Father of the bride. Part II
results.creator_credit: Charles Shyer, Nancy Meyers and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: In this sequel to “Father of the bride” (199), itself a remake of the 1950 Vincente Minnelli film starring Elizabeth Taylor, Steve Martin reprises his role as George Banks. This time the hapless George must face becoming a grandfather, (news which triggers a mid-life crisis). along with the alarming fact that he is to be a father again. Cast includes Diane Keaton, Martin Short, Kimberly Williams, George Newbern, Kieran Culkin.
